availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Peter D. Scholl (Irvine, Estill County, Kentucky merchant and soldier)

body.p: Irvine, Estill County, Kentucky constable, merchant, and soldier. Kentucky native. Married to Goodwin Scholl. Father of Edward A. Scholl, Elizabeth A. Scholl and Mary E. Scholl. Constable in Estill County in 1850. Merchant in Estill County in 1860. Served in the 47th Kentucky Infantry (U.S.A.) as a private and quartermaster from October 5, 1863 to December 26, 1864.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Estill County, p. 59B
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Estill County, Irvine, p. 274
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Estill County, Irvine, p. 557B
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of KentuckyPeter D. Scholl, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 443.
